page.title: 07Housing
page.content: Houses are well spaced throughout the area, even in very inaccessible parts. In Fairoak and Croxton there are Council houses, in Fairoak they are backed by a lovely plantation of trees, and the Croxton houses have a magnificent veiw. Farm houses predominate the accommodation. They are either privately owned together with the farm or are rented with the farm from an estate or the Church Commissioners. Newcomers to the area have purchased and converted old houses and commute daily. The conversions are pleasing and show that thought has been given to the preservation of the original building. There is one Georgian Hall, Sugnall Hall, but no other notable large houses.
